Comment 2: 
If it's for use by an OpenGL (or DirectX) package, I think it would make more sense (and
is very easy) to define the types in the OpenGL package itself. If lots of different
packages wanted to use the same floating-point color type to interoperate, then that's a
stronger argument, but I don't see many such packages at the moment.

The analogy isn't perfect, but freetype-go defines its own geometry types in its own
packages, not in the standard package library, and I think that that works perfectly
well.
_Status changed to **Accepted**._
